metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125011 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function decode_frame of the file libavcodec/ansi.c. The manipulation leads to integer coercion error. The attack can be launched remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2').
